mdRecord.dcterms:description: Nave, showing crossing dome and apse

The Basilica of the National Shrine of the Immaculate Conception is a large Catholic minor basilica and national shrine located in Washington, D.C. The shrine is the largest Roman Catholic church in the United States and in North America. The basilica is also the tallest habitable building in Washington, D.C. Its construction began on September 23, 1920, and was completed on December 8, 2017. The basilica is the national and patronal Catholic Church of the United States. — https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basilica_of_the_National_Shrine_of_the_Immaculate_Conception [work]
